# Green Buildings in Singapore

A quick explore of how 'green' buildings are in Singapore, from the Building and Construction Authority's 2019 benchmark.

## Instructions
### To install this repo's dependencies, I use [Poetry](https://github.com/python-poetry/poetry) and [Pyenv](https://github.com/pyenv/pyenv):
1. (Terminal) Run `brew install pyenv`
1. (Terminal) Run `pyenv install 3.8`
1. (Terminal) Run `brew install poetry`
1. (Terminal) Switch current directory to `changi_wetbulb_temperature` (e.g. `cd ~/git/changi_wetbulb_temperature`)
1. (Terminal) Run `pyenv local 3.8` to have the current directory only use this version of Python
1. (Terminal) Sync your virtual environment with correct dependencies using `poetry install`
   1. If you're wondering what is currently available, run `poetry show --tree`
1. (Terminal) Start the virtual environment with `poetry shell`
1. (Poetry Shell) Forecast as you please! A good start is running `jupyter notebook`
   1. To exit Poetry Shell, run `exit` within that Terminal tab
1. (Poetry Shell) Once complete, exit the shell using `exit`
